      boolean find(java.lang.String fragName)
      Find exact match of the selected fragment on the screen Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
      Position[] findAllPos(java.lang.String fragName)
      Find all exact matches of the selected fragment on the screen and return positions on the screen
      Position[] findAllPos(java.lang.String fragName, java.lang.String customPosName)
      Find all exact matches of the selected fragment on the screen and return positions on the screen
      boolean findClick(java.lang.String fragName)
      Find exact match of the selected fragment on the screen, move mouse cursor to the center of that fragment position and click on left mouse button Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
      boolean findMove(java.lang.String fragName)
      Find exact match of the selected fragment on the screen and move mouse cursor to the center of that fragment position Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
      Position findPos(java.lang.String fragName)
      Find exact match of the selected fragment on the screen and return position on the screen Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
      Position findPos(java.lang.String fragName, java.lang.String customPosName)
      Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method Find exact match of the selected fragment on the screen and return position on the screen
      boolean findSimilar(java.lang.String fragName, double rate)
      Works similar to find() method, except it will not try to find exact match on the screen, but it will try to find best match which rate is higher than you specified.
      Position findSimilarPos(java.lang.String fragName, double rate)
      Works similar to findPos() method, except it will not try to find exact match on the screen, but it will try to find best match which rate is higher than you specified.
      Position findSimilarPos(java.lang.String fragName, double rate, java.lang.String customName)
      Works similar to findPos() method, except it will not try to find exact match on the screen, but it will try to find best match which rate is higher than you specified.

      Grab the screenshot and transform it to int matrix for future fragment searches, take a full screen image, pretty slow operation

      Position recentPos()
      Get last successful fragment search(Fragment has been found) position on the screen After each single fragment search operation, last position is being saved and could be accessed via this method Tip: Very useful to make code look pretty
      void reloadFrags()
      Manually reload fragments if you create fragments from a script at run

      void searchRect()
      Remove search bounds limit, so next search will be performed on whole screen
      void searchRect(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Set search bounds limit, so next search will be performed on limited region, this will affect on fragment searching time(reduce searching delay) Tip: This can improve searching speed, if you surely know, where your fragment will appear
      void searchRect(Position mp1, int w, int h)
      Set search bounds limit, so next search will be performed on limited region, this will affect on fragment searching time(reduce searching delay) Tip: This can improve searching speed, if you surely know, where your fragment will appear

      • findClick

        public boolean findClick(java.lang.String fragName)
                  throws java.awt.AWTException,
                         FragmentNotLoadedException,
                         ScreenNotGrabbedException
        Find exact match of the selected fragment on the screen, move mouse cursor to the center of that fragment position and click on left mouse button Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        java.awt.AWTException - AWTException
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method

      • findMove

      • waitFor

        public boolean waitFor(java.lang.String fragName,
                       int time,
                       int delay,
                       Position mp1,
                       Position mp2)
                throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                       ScreenNotGrabbedException,
                       java.lang.Exception
        Wait for particular fragment appear on the screen, continuously capture the screen and search for exact matching fragment on the screen. Will return true, if fragment has appeared, false if fragment was not found until timeout Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        time - Maximum delay until return false by timeout
        delay - Delay between screen captures, this will affect overall system load
        mp1 - Position Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        mp2 - Position Searching limit bounds (bottom right corner)
        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • waitFor

        public boolean waitFor(java.lang.String fragName,
                       int time,
                       int delay,
                       Position mp1,
                       int w,
                       int h)
                throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                       ScreenNotGrabbedException,
                       java.lang.Exception
        Wait for particular fragment appear on the screen, continuously capture the screen and search for exact matching fragment on the screen. Will return true, if fragment has appeared, false if fragment was not found until timeout Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        time - Maximum delay until return false by timeout
        delay - Delay between screen captures, this will affect overall system load
        mp1 - Position Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        w - Width
        h - Height
        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

        y1 - Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)

      • waitForHide

        public boolean waitForHide(java.lang.String fragName,
                           int time,
                           int delay,
                           Position mp1,
                           Position mp2)
                    throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                           ScreenNotGrabbedException,
                           java.lang.Exception
        Wait for particular fragment disappear from the screen, continuously capture the screen and search for exact matching fragment on the screen. Will return true, if fragment has disappeared, false if fragment still being found Tip: Limiting searching bounds will affect performance and reduce searching delays Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        time - Maximum delay until return false by timeout
        delay - Delay between screen captures, this will affect overall system load
        mp1 - Position Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        mp2 - Position Searching limit bounds (bottom right corner)
        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • waitForHide

        public boolean waitForHide(java.lang.String fragName,
                           int time,
                           int delay,
                           Position mp1,
                           int w,
                           int h)
                    throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                           ScreenNotGrabbedException,
                           java.lang.Exception
        Wait for particular fragment disappear from the screen, continuously capture the screen and search for exact matching fragment on the screen. Will return true, if fragment has disappeared, false if fragment still being found Tip: Limiting searching bounds will affect performance and reduce searching delays Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        time - Maximum delay until return false by timeout
        delay - Delay between screen captures, this will affect overall system load
        mp1 - Position Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        w - Width
        h - Height
        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • waitForHide

        public boolean waitForHide(java.lang.String fragName,
                           int time,
                           int delay,
                           int x1,
                           int y1,
                           int x2,
                           int y2)
                    throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                           ScreenNotGrabbedException,
                           java.lang.Exception
        Wait for particular fragment disappear from the screen, continuously capture the screen and search for exact matching fragment on the screen. Will return true, if fragment has disappeared, false if fragment still being found Tip: Limiting searching bounds will affect performance and reduce searching delays Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        time - Maximum delay until return false by timeout
        delay - Delay between screen captures, this will affect overall system load
        x1 - Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        y1 - Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        x2 - Searching limit bounds (bottom right corner)
        y2 - Searching limit bounds (bottom right corner)
        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • waitForHide

        public boolean waitForHide(java.lang.String fragName,
                           int time,
                           int delay)
                    throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                           ScreenNotGrabbedException,
                           java.lang.Exception
        Wait for particular fragment disappear from the screen, continuously capture the screen without any delay between captures and search for exact matching fragment on the screen. Will return true, if fragment has disappeared, false if fragment still being found Tip: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        time - Maximum delay until return false by timeout
        delay - Delay between screen captures, this will affect overall system load
        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • findSimilar

        public boolean findSimilar(java.lang.String fragName,
                           double rate)
                    throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                           ScreenNotGrabbedException
        Works similar to find() method, except it will not try to find exact match on the screen, but it will try to find best match which rate is higher than you specified. This method will also find exact match just like findPos() Tip: Use this if some pixels differ, this method is able to find fragment under noise conditions Tip 2: This method is very slow, so try to avoid searching on whole screen, searchRect() method will help you to limit searching bounds and reduce searching delay Tip 3: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        rate - similarity rate 0.9 is 90%, 0.99 is 99%
        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method

      • findSimilarPos

        public Position findSimilarPos(java.lang.String fragName,
                               double rate)
                        throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                               ScreenNotGrabbedException
        Works similar to findPos() method, except it will not try to find exact match on the screen, but it will try to find best match which rate is higher than you specified. This method will also find exact match just like findPos() Tip: Use this if some pixels differ, this method is able to find fragment under noise conditions Tip 2: This method is very slow, so try to avoid searching on whole screen, searchRect() method will help you to limit searching bounds and reduce searching delay Tip 3: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        rate - similarity rate 0.9 is 90%, 0.99 is 99%
        Returns:
        NULL or Position position on the screen
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method

      • findSimilarPos

        public Position findSimilarPos(java.lang.String fragName,
                               double rate,
                               java.lang.String customName)
                        throws FragmentNotLoadedException,
                               ScreenNotGrabbedException
        Works similar to findPos() method, except it will not try to find exact match on the screen, but it will try to find best match which rate is higher than you specified. This method will also find exact match just like findPos() Tip: Use this if some pixels differ, this method is able to find fragment under noise conditions Tip 2: This method is very slow, so try to avoid searching on whole screen, searchRect() method will help you to limit searching bounds and reduce searching delay Tip 3: This method store last Position, that can be accessed via recentPos() method
        Parameters:
        fragName - Regular fragment name you are trying to find on the screen
        rate - similarity rate 0.9 is 90%, 0.99 is 99%
        customName - Position name, if fragment has been found on the screen
        Returns:
        NULL or Position position on the screen
        Throws:
        FragmentNotLoadedException - Occurs if fragment was not loaded, check if fragment name is correct
        ScreenNotGrabbedException - Occurs if grab() was not called before calling this method

      • recentPos

        public Position recentPos()
        Get last successful fragment search(Fragment has been found) position on the screen After each single fragment search operation, last position is being saved and could be accessed via this method Tip: Very useful to make code look pretty
        Returns:
        Position of last fragment being found in single (find() findClick() and etc...)

      • searchRect

        public void searchRect(int x1,
                       int y1,
                       int x2,
                       int y2)
        Set search bounds limit, so next search will be performed on limited region, this will affect on fragment searching time(reduce searching delay) Tip: This can improve searching speed, if you surely know, where your fragment will appear
        Parameters:
        x1 - Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        y1 - Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        x2 - Searching limit bounds (bottom right corner)
        y2 - Searching limit bounds (bottom right corner)

      • searchRect

                       int w,
                       int h)

        Parameters:
        mp1 - Searching limit bounds (upper left corner)
        w - Width
        h - Height

      • searchRect

      • searchRect

        public void searchRect(Region mr)
        Set search bounds limit, so next search will be performed on limited region, this will affect on fragment searching time(reduce searching delay) Tip: This can improve searching speed, if you surely know, where your fragment will appear
        Parameters:
        mr - Region searching limit bounds

      • searchRect

        public void searchRect()
        Remove search bounds limit, so next search will be performed on whole screen

      • grab

        public void grab()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Grab the screenshot and transform it to int matrix for future fragment searches, take a full screen image, pretty slow operation
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • grab

        public void grab(int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Grab the screenshot and transform it to int matrix for future fragment searches, pretty slow operation, speed depends on screen size. Tip: Smaller area being captured faster than huge one, but dependency is not linear
        Parameters:
        x1 - Specify capture bounds (upper left corner)
        y1 - Specify capture bounds (upper left corner)
        x2 - Specify capture bounds (bottom right corner)
        y2 - Specify capture bounds (bottom right corner)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • grab

        public void grab(Position mp,
                 int w,
                 int h)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Grab the screenshot and transform it to int matrix for future fragment searches, pretty slow operation, speed depends on screen size. Tips: Smaller area being captured faster than huge one, but dependency is not linear
        Parameters:
        mp - Position to specify capture bounds (upper left corner)
        w - width
        h - height
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • screenPixel

        public int screenPixel(int x,
                       int y)
        Get particular pixel value on the screen
        Parameters:
        x - X axis value
        y - Y axis value
        Returns:
        signed 32 bit ARGB (Alpha Red Greeb Blue), 0xFFFFFFFF equals to -1

      • screenPixelARGB

        public byte[] screenPixelARGB(int x,
                              int y)
        Get particular pixel value on the screen as 4 signed bytes
        Parameters:
        x - X axis value
        y - Y axis value
        Returns:
        signed 4 byte ARGB (Alpha Red Greeb Blue), 0xFF equals to -1

        Current mouse delay in milliseconds, 1 second = 1000 milliseconds
